author: Mike Dillamore
comment: Very neat design: minimalist and geeky. Exactly what I was looking for.

author: MaxTheSpy
comment: After having many Google searches I finally understand what the two bottom lines mean. I like the inclusion of epox time though the only time I would use it is for very precise time measurements such as when something happened noteworthy. And utc time I use with all my friends all over the world so we can easily coordinate Skype calls and online gaming sessions
title: Love it so far

author: Thomas Gladdines
comment: I'm not really a fan of the watch face but I do love your github link!  The sample watch face from google is kinda complicated in some parts but your github link cleared it all up for me, now I finally understand how to correctly implement settings in my own watchfaces :D  So I've bought it as a thank you for the source code which helped me a lot ^^

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: Awesome! I'm glad the code helped you out. Thanks for the support!

title: Great

author: William Plummer
comment: I regularly maintain a system that solely deals in UTC. Logs, requests, everything is utc. Being able to tell at a glance what time it is both in localtime and UTC is a huge time-saver. Plus since the background is dark it gets pretty great battery life!
title: Wonderful watch face, has actually helped me at work.

author: Frank Domizio
comment: I work in computer forensics and I would love to have this face. I cannot get it to show as an option in the wear app or on my watch.

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: Hi Frank. While developing this, I noticed that sometimes Android Wear gets stuck when deploying new packages to the watch. Here's what I'd recommend trying. 1. Uninstall DevOps Time; 2. Reboot watch; 3. Reboot phone; 4. Install DevOps Time; 5. Wait 5 minutes; 6. Check the Android Wear app. Hopefully that gets you back on track.

title: No dice

author: Faraz Shah
comment: The only thing missing for me is the ability to customize the background pattern and color.  I would not be opposed to being able to load a custom background image either.

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion!  I put this on the feature request list for a future version.

title: Background

author: Jeff Ober
comment: Can you add watch and phone battery?

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion!  I put this on the feature request list for a future version.

title: Great, but...

author: Chris Miles
comment: New version works great. Just remember to access settings from Android Wear itself on the phone rather than standalone app.

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: Hi Chris! Open the Android Wear app on your phone. There you can select the watch face. Once it is selected there will be a gear icon over the preview image. Click that and it will launch the configuration screen. Sorry, but that's the way Google wants it according to their new Wear guidelines.

title: Simple but perfect

author: Matt Wells
comment: My UTC timezone reverts back. Outside of that I love it.

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: Great catch, Matt.  I fixed this bug in v3.0.4.  Sorry about that!

title: Love it, one issue

author: Adam Birch
comment: Love this watch face. I'm in the security field and we use a 24 hour clock. Very handy having both 12 and 24 hour formats.
title: Great for people like me

author: Alex Baker
comment: I love looking at syslogs and my watch in the same format.  It just makes those tedious minutes tick by faster somehow.  That or something is wrong with the app... No no, must be the former.
title: I love looking at syslogs and my watch in the same format

author: Steve Williams
title: This watch face is my favorite

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: This will be configurable in version 2.0.  Standby for an update soon!

author: Istvan Balazs
comment: Nice watchface,  but please make a 24 Hour option also.  Thx

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: 24-hour time is now supported in v1.1.

title: Nice watchface

author: Islam Eldib
comment: The most awesome watch face ever ! Now I can tell UTC to est when reading through logs ! Revised my review.

reply.author: Richard Banasiak
reply.content: I added this feature to version 2.1 which is rolling out now.  Thanks!

title: UTC !
